titlestmt.titleproper: John West Collection, 1997-2000 Special Collection JW
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to his Holdings at the Black Film Center/Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-07-02 04:03:26 -0400.

did.abstract: Materials related to the film Bar-Be-Q.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John West was born June 21, 1970 in Chicago, Illinois. After graduating from Paul Robeson High School in Chicago, Mr. West attended Alabama A&M University and became a professional football player, playing one year in the NFL with the Los Angeles Raiders, as well as stints in the Canadian Football League with the Ottawa Rough Riders and the Shreveport Pirates. Following his sports career, Mr. West decided to go into show business, landing his first acting job in 1997 as a bailiff on the popular sitcom "Martin." He also had a recurring role on the police drama "New York Undercover." Despite having no formal education in film production, in 2000 Mr. West wrote, directed and starred in the film Bar-Be-Q, which played theatrically in the South and Chicago. Mr. West currently resides in Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this collection contains material related to the 2000 film Bar-Be-Q, written and directed by John West. The collection includes a 35mm print of the film, as well as the screenplay, a VHS cassette of several television interviews with West at the time of the film's release, and an assortment of promotional materials and newspaper clippings pertaining to the film.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in January 2005.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], John West Collection, Special Collection JW, Black Film Center/Archive, Indiana University, Bloomington.

did.unittitle: VHS cassette with two local television interviews from time of film's release (app. 30 min)
Screenplay with cast list and script breakdown
Photograph of West standing in front of Bar-Be-Q poster
Signed poster (11x17) -- laser printer -- "To Indiana U."

To Have and to Hold (year unknown) DVD -- 6 copies (1 with general collection)
